New Records: Merih Demiral scored a brace in 57 seconds and 59 minutes, setting a record for the fastest goals in a Euro match
Key Match Events: Merih Demiral scored twice, both from corners, with Arda Guler delivering the corners.
Mert Gunok made a crucial save on a towering header by Christoph Baumgartner in stoppage time.
Michael Gregoritsch scored Austria's only goal from a corner kick.
Pre-Game Insights: Turkey's momentum and belief after a last-minute win against the Czech Republic was a key factor.
Austria's strategy involved pinning Turkey back but couldn't capitalize effectively.
Post-Match Reflections: Turkey's coach Vincenzo Montella highlighted the team's resilience and edge-of-the-bench play.
The Netherlands, having defeated Romania, set up a quarter-final clash with Turkey.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was Turkey's first in the Euro 2024 knockout stage since 2008.
Player ratings showed strong performances from both teams, with Merih Demiral and Arda Guler standing out.
Others: The match was live-streamed on discovery+, and key stats included Turkey's two goals from corners and Austria's one goal from a corner.
